column3: Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/506e17ceb9d09b3914dc3814afe0915a191d0bf4 for binaries and test log.\n
What happens with your `if (nTries > 100)`, when after that a node occurs in addrman, to which we can connect. Is there a retry timeout or a user feedback somehow?\n

@Diapolo You're not the first to miss it, so I added a comment to clarify: that break does not stop trying new addresses, it just returns to the outer loop, which sleeps, recalculates allowed address ranges, adds seed nodes, ... before continuing.\n
ACK. Tests out okay to me.\n
Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/f161a2c2114cd7d950248ce75a91ba1923e9abb1 for binaries and test log.\n
